data.name: BadConnection
data.value: Failed creating connection: {exceptionMessage}

data.name: BadSequenceType
data.value: Cannot scaffold sequence '{sequenceName}' because it uses type '{typeName}' which is unsupported.

data.name: BundleFullName
data.value: Entity Framework Core Migrations Bundle

data.name: CannotFindDesignTimeProviderAssemblyAttribute
data.value: Unable to find expected assembly attribute [DesignTimeProviderServices] in provider assembly '{runtimeProviderAssemblyName}'. This attribute is required to identify the class which acts as the design-time service provider factory for the provider.

data.name: CannotFindRuntimeProviderAssembly
data.value: Unable to find provider assembly '{assemblyName}'. Ensure the name is correct and it's referenced by the project.

data.name: CannotFindTypeMappingForColumn
data.value: Could not find type mapping for column '{columnName}' with data type '{dateType}'. Skipping column.

data.name: CannotGenerateTypeQualifiedMethodCall
data.value: A type-qualified method call requires an instance identifier, a MethodInfo and no chained calls.

data.name: CompiledModelConstructorBinding
data.value: The entity type '{entityType}' has a custom constructor binding. This is usually caused by using proxies. Compiled model can't be generated, because dynamic proxy types are not supported. If you are not using proxies configure the custom constructor binding in '{customize}' in a partial '{className}' class instead.

data.name: CompiledModelCustomCacheKeyFactory
data.value: The context is configured to use a custom model cache key factory '{factoryType}', this usually indicates that the produced model can change between context instances. To preserve this behavior manually modify the generated compiled model source code.

data.name: CompiledModelDefiningQuery
data.value: The entity type '{entityType}' has a defining query configured. Compiled model can't be generated, because defining queries are not supported.

data.name: CompiledModelGenerated
data.value: Successfully generated a compiled model, to use it call '{optionsCall}'. Run this command again when the model is modified.

data.name: CompiledModelQueryFilter
data.value: The entity type '{entityType}' has a query filter configured. Compiled model can't be generated, because query filters are not supported.

data.name: CompiledModelTypeMapping
data.value: The property '{entityType}.{property}' has a custom type mapping configured. Configure it in '{customize}' in a partial '{className}' class instead.

data.name: CompiledModelValueComparer
data.value: The property '{entityType}.{property}' has a value comparer configured using a ValueComparer instance. Instead, create types that inherit from ValueConverter and ValueComparer and use '{method}=<ConverterType, ComparerType=>()' or '{method}(Type converterType, Type comparerType)' to configure the value converter and comparer.

data.name: CompiledModelValueConverter
data.value: The property '{entityType}.{property}' has a value converter configured using a ValueConverter instance or inline expressions. Instead, create a type that inherits from ValueConverter and use '{method}=<ConverterType=>()' or '{method}(Type converterType)' to configure the value converter.

data.name: CompiledModelValueGenerator
data.value: The property '{entityType}.{property}' has a value generator configured. Use '{method}' to configure the value generator factory type.

data.name: ConflictingContextAndMigrationName
data.value: The name you have chosen for the migration, '{name}', is the same as the context class name. Please choose a different name for your migration. Might we suggest 'InitialCreate' for your first migration?

data.name: ConnectionDescription
data.value: The connection string to the database. Defaults to the one specified in AddDbContext or OnConfiguring.

data.name: ContextClassNotValidCSharpIdentifier
data.value: The context class name '{contextClassName}' is not a valid C# identifier.

data.name: DatabaseDropped
data.value: Successfully dropped database '{name}'.

data.name: DestructiveOperation
data.value: An operation was scaffolded that may result in the loss of data. Please review the migration for accuracy.

data.name: Done
data.value: Done.

data.name: DroppingDatabase
data.value: Dropping database '{database}' on server '{dataSource}'.

data.name: DuplicateMigrationName
data.value: The name '{migrationName}' is used by an existing migration.

data.name: EncodingIgnored
data.value: The encoding '{encoding}' specified in the output directive will be ignored. EF Core always scaffolds files using the encoding 'utf-8'.

data.name: ErrorConnecting
data.value: An error occurred while accessing the database. Continuing without the information provided by the database. Error: {message}

data.name: ExistingFiles
data.value: The following file(s) already exist in directory '{outputDirectoryName}': {existingFiles}. Use the Force flag to overwrite these files.

data.name: FindingContextFactories
data.value: Finding IDesignTimeDbContextFactory implementations...

data.name: FindingContexts
data.value: Finding DbContext classes...

data.name: FindingDesignTimeServices
data.value: Finding IDesignTimeServices implementations in assembly '{startupAssembly}'...

data.name: FindingHostingServices
data.value: Finding Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting service provider...

data.name: FindingProviderServices
data.value: Finding design-time services for provider '{provider}'...

data.name: FindingReferencedContexts
data.value: Finding DbContext classes in the project...

data.name: FindingReferencedServices
data.value: Finding design-time services referenced by assembly '{startupAssembly}'...

data.name: FindingServiceProvider
data.value: Finding application service provider in assembly '{startupAssembly}'...

data.name: ForceRemoveMigration
data.value: Unable to check if the migration '{name}' has been applied to the database. If it has, you will need to manually revert its changes. Error encountered while checking: {error}

data.name: ForeignKeyPrincipalEndContainsNullableColumns
data.value: The principal end of the foreign key '{foreignKeyName}' is supported by the unique index '{indexName}' and contains the following nullable columns '{columnNames}'. Entity Framework requires the properties representing those columns to be non-nullable.

data.name: ForeignKeyScaffoldErrorPrincipalKeyNotFound
data.value: Could not scaffold the foreign key '{foreignKeyName}'. A key for '{columnsList}' was not found in the principal entity type '{principalEntityType}'.

data.name: ForeignKeyScaffoldErrorPrincipalTableNotFound
data.value: Could not scaffold the foreign key '{foreignKeyName}'. The referenced table could not be found. This most likely occurred because the referenced table was excluded from scaffolding.

data.name: ForeignKeyScaffoldErrorPrincipalTableScaffoldingError
data.value: Could not scaffold the foreign key '{foreignKeyName}'. The referenced table '{principalTableName}' could not be scaffolded.

data.name: ForeignKeyScaffoldErrorPropertyNotFound
data.value: Could not scaffold the foreign key '{foreignKeyName}'. The following columns in the foreign key could not be scaffolded: {columnNames}.

data.name: ForeignKeyWithSameFacetsExists
data.value: Could not scaffold the foreign key '{foreignKeyName}'. Foreign key '{existingForeignKey}' is defined on same columns targeting same key on principal table.

data.name: ForeignMigrations
data.value: The namespace '{migrationsNamespace}' contains migrations for a different DbContext. This can result in conflicting migration names. It's recommend to put migrations for different DbContext classes into different namespaces.

data.name: FoundContextFactory
data.value: Found IDesignTimeDbContextFactory implementation '{factory}'.

data.name: FoundDbContext
data.value: Found DbContext '{contextType}'.

data.name: InvokeCreateHostBuilderFailed
data.value: An error occurred while accessing the Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting services. Continuing without the application service provider. Error: {error}

data.name: LiteralExpressionNotSupported
data.value: The literal expression '{expression}' for '{type}' cannot be parsed. Only simple constructor calls and factory methods are supported.

data.name: MalformedCreateHostBuilder
data.value: An unexpected return type was encountered while accessing the Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting services. Method 'CreateHostBuilder(string[])' should return an object of type 'IHostBuilder'. Continuing without the application service provider.

data.name: ManuallyDeleted
data.value: The model snapshot and the backing model of the last migration are different. Continuing under the assumption that the last migration was deleted manually.

data.name: MigrationDescription
data.value: The target migration. If '0', all migrations will be reverted. Defaults to the last migration.

data.name: MigrationsAssemblyMismatch
data.value: Your target project '{assembly}' doesn't match your migrations assembly '{migrationsAssembly}'. Either change your target project or change your migrations assembly. Change your migrations assembly by using DbContextOptionsBuilder. E.g. options.UseSqlServer(connection, b => b.MigrationsAssembly("{assembly}")). By default, the migrations assembly is the assembly containing the DbContext. Change your target project to the migrations project by using the Package Manager Console's Default project drop-down list, or by executing "dotnet ef" from the directory containing the migrations project.

data.name: MultipleAnnotationConflict
data.value: The annotation '{annotationName}' was specified twice with potentially different values. Specifying the same annotation multiple times for different providers is no longer supported. Review the generated Migration to ensure it is correct and, if necessary, edit the Migration to fix any issues.

data.name: MultipleContexts
data.value: More than one DbContext was found. Specify which one to use. Use the '-Context' parameter for PowerShell commands and the '--context' parameter for dotnet commands.

data.name: MultipleContextsWithName
data.value: More than one DbContext named '{name}' was found. Specify which one to use by providing its fully qualified name.

data.name: MultipleContextsWithQualifiedName
data.value: More than one DbContext named '{name}' was found. Specify which one to use by providing its fully qualified name using its exact case.

data.name: NoColorDescription
data.value: Don't colorize output.

data.name: NoContext
data.value: No DbContext was found in assembly '{assembly}'. Ensure that you're using the correct assembly and that the type is neither abstract nor generic.

data.name: NoContextWithName
data.value: No DbContext named '{name}' was found.

data.name: NoCreateHostBuilder
data.value: No static method 'CreateHostBuilder(string[])' was found on class 'Program'.

data.name: NoDesignTimeServices
data.value: No design-time services were found.

data.name: NoLanguageService
data.value: The project language '{language}' isn't supported by the built-in {service} service. You can try looking for an additional NuGet package which supports this language; moving your DbContext type to a C# class library referenced by this project; or manually implementing and registering the design-time service for the programming language.

data.name: NoMigrationFile
data.value: No file named '{file}' was found. You must manually remove the migration class '{migrationClass}'.

data.name: NoMigrationMetadataFile
data.value: No file named '{file}' was found.

data.name: NonNullableBoooleanColumnHasDefaultConstraint
data.value: The column '{columnName}' would normally be mapped to a non-nullable bool property, but it has a default constraint. Such a column is mapped to a nullable bool property to allow a difference between setting the property to false and invoking the default constraint. See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=851278 for details.

data.name: NonRelationalProvider
data.value: The provider '{provider}' is not a Relational provider and therefore cannot be used with Migrations.

data.name: NoParameterlessConstructor
data.value: Unable to create an object of type '{contextType}'. For the different patterns supported at design time, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=851728

data.name: NoReferencedServices
data.value: No referenced design-time services were found.

data.name: NoRelationalConnection
data.value: Connection information is only available for relational database providers.

data.name: NoServiceProvider
data.value: No application service provider was found.

data.name: NoSnapshot
data.value: No ModelSnapshot was found.

data.name: NoSnapshotFile
data.value: No file named '{file}' was found. You must manually remove the model snapshot class '{snapshotClass}'.

data.name: NotExistDatabase
data.value: Database '{name}' did not exist, no action was taken.

data.name: PrefixDescription
data.value: Prefix output with level.

data.name: PrimaryKeyErrorPropertyNotFound
data.value: Could not scaffold the primary key for '{tableName}'. The following columns in the primary key could not be scaffolded: {columnNames}.

data.name: ProviderReturnedNullModel
data.value: Metadata model returned should not be null. Provider: {providerTypeName}.

data.name: ReadOnlyFiles
data.value: No files were generated in directory '{outputDirectoryName}'. The following file(s) already exist(s) and must be made writeable to continue: {readOnlyFiles}.

data.name: RemovingMigration
data.value: Removing migration '{name}'.

data.name: RemovingSnapshot
data.value: Removing model snapshot.

data.name: ReusingNamespace
data.value: Reusing namespace of type '{type}'.

data.name: ReusingSnapshotName
data.value: Reusing model snapshot name '{name}'.

data.name: RevertingSnapshot
data.value: Reverting the model snapshot.

data.name: RevertMigration
data.value: The migration '{name}' has already been applied to the database. Revert it and try again. If the migration has been applied to other databases, consider reverting its changes using a new migration instead.

data.name: SensitiveInformationWarning
data.value: To protect potentially sensitive information in your connection string, you should move it out of source code. You can avoid scaffolding the connection string by using the Name= syntax to read it from configuration - see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2131148. For more guidance on storing connection strings, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=723263.
data.comment: Localize the URL if we have localized docs.

data.name: SequencesRequireName
data.value: Sequence name cannot be null or empty. Entity Framework cannot model a sequence that does not have a name.

data.name: UnableToGenerateEntityType
data.value: Unable to generate entity type for table '{tableName}' since its primary key could not be scaffolded.

data.name: UnableToScaffoldIndexMissingProperty
data.value: Unable to scaffold the index '{indexName}'. The following columns could not be scaffolded: {columnNames}.

data.name: UnhandledEnumValue
data.value: Unhandled enum value '{enumValue}'.

data.name: UnknownDirectiveProcessor
data.value: Failed to resolve type for directive processor {name}.

data.name: UnknownLiteral
data.value: Cannot scaffold C# literals of type '{literalType}'. The provider should implement CoreTypeMapping.GenerateCodeLiteral to support using it at design time.

data.name: UnknownOperation
data.value: The current CSharpMigrationOperationGenerator cannot scaffold operations of type '{operationType}'. Configure your design-time services to use one that can.

data.name: UnreferencedAssembly
data.value: Could not load assembly '{assembly}'. Ensure it is referenced by the startup project '{startupProject}'.

data.name: UseContext
data.value: Using context '{name}'.

data.name: UsingDbContextFactory
data.value: Using DbContext factory '{factory}'.

data.name: UsingDesignTimeServices
data.value: Using design-time services from class '{designTimeServices}'.

data.name: UsingEnvironment
data.value: Using environment '{environment}'.

data.name: UsingHostingServices
data.value: Using application service provider from Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.

data.name: UsingProviderServices
data.value: Using design-time services from provider '{provider}'.

data.name: UsingReferencedServices
data.value: Using design-time services from assembly '{referencedAssembly}'.

data.name: VerboseDescription
data.value: Show verbose output.

data.name: VersionMismatch
data.value: The Entity Framework tools version '{toolsVersion}' is older than that of the runtime '{runtimeVersion}'. Update the tools for the latest features and bug fixes. See https://aka.ms/AAc1fbw for more information.

data.name: WritingMigration
data.value: Writing migration to '{file}'.

data.name: WritingSnapshot
data.value: Writing model snapshot to '{file}'.
